intro: Drosanthemum concavum, commonly known as the concave daisies, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent characteristics and ability to thrive in arid environments. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically blooming in spring and summer. Its leaves are fleshy and often have a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss. Drosanthemum concavum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
